intro: Pelecyphora macromeris, commonly known as the large-leaf pelecyphora, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically borne on short peduncles. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Pelecyphora macromeris is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
